importantArticles.headline: It might seem like investors in Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) can't catch a break these days.  Despite the strong results, however, it's clear that investors are worried about much more than near-term deliveries.  Lucid also announced it would raise $1 billion in convertible debt, and capital raises can often lower the value of a company's shares.
importantArticles.title: 3 Reasons Lucid Stock Is Sliding Despite Record Q1 Deliveries

importantArticles.headline: Lucid Group (NasdaqGS:LCID) recently reported that it delivered 3,109 vehicles in the first quarter of 2025, while producing 2,212 vehicles and sending an additional 600 to Saudi Arabia for assembly. This announcement coincided with its preliminary earnings guidance projecting revenue between $232 million and $236 million for the quarter, likely influencing the company's 13.21% share price increase over the past month. This positive movement occurred despite broader market declines prompted...
importantArticles.title: Lucid Group (NasdaqGS:LCID) Delivers 3,109 Vehicles With Revenue Guidance Of US$232M+

importantArticles.headline: Lucid Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: LCID) today announced the pricing of its offering of $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 5.00% convertible senior notes due 2030 in a private offering to persons reasonably believed to be qualified institutional buyers pursuant to Rule 144A under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended. The issuance and sale of the notes are scheduled to settle on or about April 8, 2025, subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions. Lucid also granted the initial
importantArticles.title: Lucid Group, Inc. Prices $1,000,000,000 Convertible Senior Notes Offering

importantArticles.headline: Lucid delivers 3,109 cars in the first quarter, the highest quarterly total in the company’s history and in line with Wall Street estimates.
importantArticles.title: Lucid Had Its Best Quarter Ever. Why the Stock Is Falling.

importantArticles.headline: Signs of Tesla's (NASDAQ: TSLA) brand crisis are almost everywhere you look.  Over the weekend, more than 200 "Tesla Takedown" protests were held across the country as Americans expressed their ire about CEO Elon Musk's project to downsize federal agencies -- which President Donald Trump refers to as the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) -- by targeting his company.  Sales in Europe appear to be plunging; registration data showed Tesla sales were down 42% across most of Europe in the first two months of the year.
importantArticles.title: Will Tesla's Pain Be This EV Stock's Gain?

importantArticles.headline: Apple and other major U.S. tech stocks tumble after President Donald Trump announces sweeping global tariffs, Nvidia falls even as the White House says tariffs on Taiwan wouldn’t apply to semiconductors, and apparel makers such as Nike drop sharply since they use Asian factories to make most of their products.
importantArticles.title: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Apple, Nvidia, Tesla, Nike, Dell, Bank of America, RH, Lamb Weston, and More

importantArticles.headline: Shares of Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) are climbing on Wednesday.  The luxury electric vehicle (EV) maker's stock gained 3.3% as of 2:47 p.m. ET and was up as much as 9.9% earlier in the day.  It was reported today that the EV start-up is seeing increased interest from former Tesla owners as its second vehicle enters production.
importantArticles.title: Why Lucid Group Stock Is Soaring Today

importantArticles.headline: Madison Mills outlines the top stories of the day as part of Tuesday morning's Market Minute, including Lucid Group (LCID) gaining market share from Tesla (TSLA), Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ) bankruptcy case, and PVH's (PVH) stronger-than-expected outlook. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
